intro: Hedlundia lonetalensis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hedlundia, is a small evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and narrow, leathery leaves that are typically dark green in color. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers during the late spring and early summer months. Hedlundia lonetalensis is well adapted to coastal environments, tolerating salt spray and sandy soils. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
